name: Comet Sighted
text: People are often superstitious and the appearance of a comet has convinced many that the end of times is soon to come. Whether or not this is actually the case, this is bound to cause some instability within the nation.

choices.text: It is an omen!
The end is nigh!
Keep looking at the sky!

name: Comet Spotted
text: A comet was sighted in the sky. Some peolple in the past believed that this portends fell times ahead. Others used to believe that they are in fact pixie fairies floating in the sky. Such primitive ways of thinking, it's almost embarrasing that our ancestors used to believe in such nonsensical rubbish like that.

choices.text: Thank God we live in such enlightened times.

name: Artists Protest the Eiffel Tower
text: 'We, writers, painters, sculptors, architects and passionate devotees of the hitherto untouched beauty of this nation, protest with all our strength, against the erection of this useless and monstrous Eiffel Tower. To bring our arguments home, imagine for a moment a giddy, ridiculous tower dominating this city like a gigantic black smokestack, crushing under its barbaric bulk all of our humiliated monuments which will disappear in this ghastly dream.'

choices.text: Idiots
We can't take it down! We're using it as a radio tower!
uniques: Gain a free [Broadcast Tower] [in this city]

choices.text: Fine, let's tear it down.
uniques: [-1 Happiness] per [2] social policies adopted <hidden from users>

name: A Destitute Noble
text: A destitute nobleman has arrived at your court. He is without Lord and pledges his service your name. The nobleman is ragged and unkempt, but adorned with many scars, and has evidently fielded many battles. It is up to you what is to be done with him.

choices.text: Turn him away! We don't need him stinking up the Court!
Have him cleaned up and suited with armor.
Confiscate what little estate he possesses and then have him executed!

name: The Guest Star
text: The year is 1054, a star has appeared in the heavens. It glows with a breathtaking brilliance, captivating the entirety of the nation. The event is surely one of great significance.

choices.text: Such beauty!
A astronomical miracle!

name: Solar Eclipse
text: The nation stares in awe as the Sun slowly disappears behind the black disc suspended in the sky, and the world turns to darkness despite it being mid-day. Your subjects are absolutely terrified.

choices.text: Our prayers and sacrifices shall bring back the light.
There must be a reasonable explanation.

name: Mercenaries
text: A band of mercenaries, fresh from some foreign war now settled, has arrived at your Palace, and offer their services to you. These are no mere vagabonds; these are professional soldiers. If not us, then they might turn to our enemies.

choices.text: We shall have no foreigners in our armies!
We must turn them away!
Pay them well, and bring them into our service!

name: PMC's
text: An organisation of PMC's, fresh from some foreign war now settled, has sent a message to the military, and offer their services to you. These are no mere insurgents; these are true veterans. If not us, then they might turn to our enemies.

choices.text: We shall have no guns-for-hire in our armies!
We must turn them away!
Pay them well, and bring them into our service!

name: Struck Oil!
text: Glorious news! Our workers have found a rich source of oil on a nearby plot of land! The oil is sitting there, just waiting for us to drill it out.

choices.text: Pay them well, and bring them into our service!

name: A Beast Stalks the City
text: Rumors have begun to filter into the Palace that a monstrous beast stalks the city streets at the dead of night. Eye-witnesses claim that the beast is a demon, others claim it is the elusive wild haggis. Regardless, it is beginning to disquiet the city, and so the matter must be dealt with.

choices.text: I do not address mere rumors.
Send out some guards and bring back the pelt of this beast.
Capture it, put it in a zoo, and charge extra to have it seen.
I shall hunt this beast myself!
